intro: Grias tetrapetala, commonly known as the four-petaled grias, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive four-petaled flowers, which are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal properties. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Grias tetrapetala is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests.
